Before moving to Singapore, Arun held worldwide accountability for growing Microsoft's SQL Server business with enterprise customers.

Arun founded Think Business Networks, Inc., a vendor of specialized network management software based out of Silicon Valley. Arun grew the company profitably for six years to over 60 employees before selling his stake and heading to Stanford Graduate School of Business for his MS in Management.

title: Co-Founder & CEO
bio:

With over 20 years of experience in data, analytics, and business intelligence, Brian has been at the forefront of driving innovation in reporting solutions that empower organizations to make informed, data-driven decisions.

The Reporting Hub was born out of Brian's vision to provide organizations with a more efficient, centralized approach to deploying, managing and interpreting business data. Under his leadership, the platform has evolved into a robust tool used by companies across the globe in all industries to simplify complex reporting workflows, integrate real-time data insights, and improve decision-making efficiency.

Prior to The Reporting Hub, Brian founded Shift Analytics in 2016, where he established himself as a global thought leader in Power BI and business intelligence adoption. His ability to connect technology to business outcomes has helped organizations worldwide unlock the full potential of their data.

Brian's passion for innovation and his deep expertise in analytics continue to shape the development of The Reporting Hub, as he works to revolutionize the way businesses interact with their data for strategic advantage.

title: Principal PM Manager
bio:
With over a decade of experience at Microsoft, I have been at the forefront of shaping and evangelizing Power BI and Microsoft's data engineering solutions. I started as a Technology Solution Professional for Business Intelligence in the Mid-Atlantic Region, where I was instrumental in aligning the Microsoft Cloud and Data Platform with the specific requirements of over 140 enterprise customers.

In 2015, I transitioned to a Senior Program Manager role on the Power BI Report Server/SQL Server Reporting Services team. My focus was on leading the development and implementation of RDL capabilities in Power BI and on-prem SSRS and Power BI Report Server.

From 2017 to 2019, I served as the Senior Product Manager for Power BI Paginated Reports and SQL Server Reporting Services. During this period, I was the lead Program Manager for Reporting Services integration in the Power BI service and managed distribution scenarios such as e-mail subscriptions.

In 2019, I was promoted to Principal Product Manager, where I led a team focusing on Reporting Services integration in the Power BI service and SQL Server Reporting Services. My responsibilities expanded to include overseeing several experiences in Microsoft Fabric for Data Engineering, including the Lakehouse, Spark Runtime, Spark Compute, Billing and Monitoring, and Platform Integration.

Today, as a Principal Program Manager, I lead a talented team of product managers that focus on shaping the future of Microsoft Fabric for Data Engineering. My team and I are committed to delivering innovative solutions in areas like Lakehouse, Spark Runtime, Spark Compute, Billing and Monitoring, and Platform Integration.

I've had the privilege of sharing my insights and experiences through interviews on the Guy in a Cube YouTube channel and the BIFocal Podcast. Additionally, I am the creator of the beloved mascot of Paginated Reports, Paginated Report Bear. This character has not only captured the hearts of the community but is also featured in his own YouTube channel and in the official Microsoft Paginated Reports in a Day online training, which has been viewed over 100,000 times.

I hold a B.A. from Temple University in Philadelphia.

title: Solution Architect, Senior Manager

I have over 20 years of experience in software engineering, with master's degrees in software engineering and data science. I also hold over 20 industry certifications, including Microsoft Solution Architect certifications for Azure, Power Platform, and Dynamics.

My core competencies include Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Dynamics, Fabric, Power Platform, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Development frameworks, tools, and DevOps, Microsoft Data and A.I. stacks, as well as the major open-source development platforms. I specialize in designing and implementing no-code, low-code, and custom solutions, leading and collaborating with on-shore and off-shore development resources and driving innovation and customer value. I am also an exceptional communicator, able to connect with both technical and non-technical audiences at every level. I have presented at several industry conferences, such as Microsoft Ready, Microsoft Convergence, and StarWest.

In my spare time, I indulge my interests in U.S.A. Swimming, space exploration, science, engineering, and Lego. I enjoy building Lego Mindstorms and Boost robots with my daughter and learning new skills and technologies. I am passionate about creating software that solves real problems and makes a positive impact.

title: Technical Fellow, Chief Architect of Azure Data
bio:
I am a Technical Fellow at Microsoft, and, in particular, the Chief Architect of Azure Data.

Azure Data includes:

1. Microsoft Fabric
2. The Intelligence Platform: Power BI, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Synapse (DataWarehouse, Spark, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Explorer aka Kusto), Cosmos, Azure Messaging.
3. The operational databases group: SQL Server, Azure SQL DB, Cosmos DB, Azure MySQL, Azure PostgreSQL.
4. Azure Databricks

I have been working inside Microsoft since 1997, after I have received the MSc degree in computer science from 'Politehnica' University of Bucharest. My responsibilities include technical strategy for the products of the Azure Data, technical tactical guidance for the teams of the division, and ... well ... a lot of coding. I am an author of 49 granted patents, and many more pending. I have received my PhD degree in Computer Science from 'Politehnica' University of Bucharest in 2006.

I am one of the core co-inventors of the SQL Server in-memory technology (Vertipaq) - the technology that is the backbone of the columnar indexes, as well as of the tabular storage engine of Analysis Services

Dan's responsibilities range from partner relations to pre-sales and customer success. In his role, he uses his solid engineering experience to evaluate new technologies and see their impact on clients' needs, from both a business impact, financial and technical perspective.  He is passionate about making clients successful and positioning them as leaders in using new technology for competitive advantage.

title: Principal Program Manager
bio: Responsible for building next generation of Big Data and Data Engineering products for enterprise customers. Currently focused on driving Spark and Delta features and experiences on Microsoft Fabric product team. MsC in Big Data Analytics and way over two decades career delivering data architectures and end to end solution across many verticals.

Daniel has over 20 years of experience working with data solution architectures, database designs, and performance tuning for both large and small businesses. His focus has lately been primarily on distributed data platforms such as Microsoft's Analytics Platform System (APS), Azure Synapse Analytics, and now Microsoft Fabric. Daniel previously started and led the Northwest Ohio SQL Server Users Group to help foster local discussion, learning, and awareness of SQL platforms.

He is best known for his work on the open source Tabular Editor and his "External Tools" ribbon contribution to Power BI Desktop. Recently, Daniel spends most of his time on Tabular Editor 3 which was launched commercially in June 2021.

title: Vice President of IT Strategy & Data
bio: Danny L. Buie is the Vice President of IT Strategy & Data at  Tyler Technologies.  Mr. Buie previously served as Chief Information Officer at Crestwood Midstream.  Prior to Crestwood, Mr. Buie served as Vice President of Information Technology at Amplify Energy and American Midstream.  Mr. Buie also served as the Senior Director of Finance and Administration Systems for Crestwood Midstream Partners LP, a gathering, processing, treating, compression, storage and transportation master limited partnership from March 2014 to March 2017.  Prior to Crestwood, Mr. Buie served as Senior Director of Enterprise Business Systems for Newpark Resources, Inc., a supplier providing products and services primarily to the oil and gas exploration and production (E&P) industry from December 2007 to July 2013 and held various management positions across several other industries.  Mr. Buie started his career with Price Waterhouse and holds a Master of Science in Analytics from Texas A&M University and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting and Management Information Systems from The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Principal Software Engineer
bio: As a Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft, I specialize in leveraging innovative technologies to tackle intricate challenges and transform industries with cloud-based solutions. My primary responsibility is to help customers harness the power of DevOps, automation, and security to drive their digital transformation in the AI and data era. I work closely with Microsoft's product groups, partners, and open-source communities to deliver cutting-edge solutions that enhance efficiency and foster innovation. My role involves not only leading and developing robust software but also ensuring exceptional Developer Experience and Engineering Fundamentals.

title: CEO and Co-Founder
bio:
Darren Goonawardana is the CEO and Co-Founder of Collectiv, a leading Microsoft consulting firm specializing in data architecture, analytics, planning, and AI. With over 30 years of experience in data strategy, business intelligence, and planning, Darren has founded and led data analytics companies across four continents, gaining unmatched insights into diverse industries and business environments.

Darren brings a unique perspective on leveraging technologies like Microsoft Fabric’s write-back functionality and generative AI integration to revolutionize organizational performance. As a dynamic thought leader, Darren specializes in bridging the gap between complex technical capabilities and actionable business outcomes.

title: Principal Program Manager, Power BI CAT
bio: David's been a Developer and Solution Architect focusing on SQL Server, .NET, and Microsoft BI solutions for a very long time.

He has worked across industries such as education, healthcare, telecommunications, entertainment, and hospitality. A Microsoft Certified Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate, David leverages Microsoft Fabric for enterprise analytics, specializing in Data Warehouse and Lakehouse solutions. Drawing on his broad industry background and modern data platform expertise, he delivers streamlined analytics and reporting for the QNMU.

David is a software and data engineering expert. He has spent decades in the data space, where early in his career was building big data analytics architectures…before the term “big data” was coined. He has been on the forefront of numerous data integration projects for many verticals and truly understands the pain points of data replication and how to guide organizations down the path of data automation using the modern data stack, with a keen focus on value-based business outcomes. David brings the fun, ‘no challenge is too big’ attitude to the world of data integration, and loves to discuss data architecture and philosophy!

With a passion for helping others, David currently works on numerous engagements with Fivetran technical partners such as speaking at partner conferences, proving capabilities with hands-on-labs, and showcasing how Fivetran integrations help customers solve their most cumbersome data woes. David also works with regional system integration partners on partner-related customer-facing events, assisting partners with implementing sound data strategies, and cultivating partner opportunities that Fivetran provides so partners can focus on what matters most - creating value for their clients. Whether he’s doing construction on a house or on a keyboard, David is always willing to dive in and go the extra mile to achieve success!

title: Program Manager

• Power BI
• Microsoft Fabric

• Azure SQL

David has worked in data and analytics since 2009 and previously worked at a Microsoft Gold Partner prior to joining Microsoft.

He champions the developer's perspective within the product group, ensuring that Azure SQL Database remains the premier choice for developers, both now and in the future, by integrating cutting-edge AI and developer-focused innovations.

She is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP, Microsoft certified trainer and Microsoft certified professional with an Associate and Expert level Certification on Data Management and Analytics. Deepthi blogs for DBANuggets.com. Deepthi is an Co-Organizer for Microsoft Data and AI South Florida user group and Data Platform Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Virtual Group. She is a Volunteer for Data platform Women in Technology user group. She is a Friend of Redgate. Along with this, Deepthi loves arts and crafts. You can contact her on Twitter @dbanuggets.

title: Microsoft MVP | Principal Consultant

I have been lucky enough to work with Power BI since its release in 2015 and gain experience in many interesting projects since the beginning. In my blog WhatTheFact.bi I write about everything related to Power BI, best practices, share tips and look forward to exchange with you!

Dennis has led high-impact projects using Power BI, Azure, Fabric, and Databricks. His expertise spans data architecture, ETL, data modeling, and advanced analytics. A Louisiana State University graduate, Dennis is dedicated to helping organizations unlock their data's potential through strategic insights and operational excellence.

Denny currently holds several Microsoft Certifications related to SQL Server 2000 through 2017, including the MCM and MVP.

bio:
Democratize data to empower every individual, team and organization to quickly turn data into insights.
Principal PM Manager within the Fabric Data warehouse team, leading Saas experiences, Billing, Security and Monitoring

His experience brings in more than 15+ years of product innovation worldwide starting from Silicon Valley start-ups innovating Internet technologies to enterprise innovation in the intelligent cloud space.

Before joining Microsoft in 2020, he spent nearly a decade as a developer, database administrator, and team lead. As a relentless learner and occasional developer, his work spreads across several blogs, videos, and samples linked from https://github.com/dzsquared. He has an MS in computer science from Georgia Tech and an MS in chemistry from the University of Minnesota.

title: Senior Vice President of Business Development
bio:
Blazing the software solutions trail at Motio, SVP of Business Development Edwin van Megesen is no stranger to the world of analytics. His previous experience as a manager at PriceWaterhouseCoopers served not only as a strong foundation to bolster his versatility and knowledge but as the spark that would ignite his passion for helping others.

Whether it’s supporting customers by helping them meet internal and external regulatory requirements, exploring analytics solutions to help organizations save time and money, or caring for the environment and humanitarian causes, Edwin approaches everything he does wholeheartedly.

From previously lecturing at the University of Twente, Hogeschool in Holland, and the Intercontinental University of Curaçao (ICUC) to saving the world, Edwin works tirelessly in all he does. He is an expert on the Analytic lifecycle development process that includes CI/CD and DevOps for Power BI. He brings this passion to organizations so they can implement streamlined work processes supported by automation, which, in turn, provides guardrails for a successful PowerBI implementation.

title: Senior Product Manager, Power BI in Teams
bio: Senior Product Manager, Power BI in Teams, Microsoft

title: BI & UX Consultant
bio:
Hi there! 👋 I’m a BI & UX Consultant passionate about turning data into meaningful, user-friendly stories. My goal? To help businesses create reports that are not just visually stunning but also intuitive and accessible—because great design makes data easier (and more fun!) to use.

Through my blog MoonStory 🌙 and speaking at international conferences, I share my love for combining dataviz and UX Design to empower teams to see their data in a whole new way.

When I’m not working magic with data, I can be found exploring the world, picking up new languages, doing yoga, and immersing myself in great books.

title: Principal Security PM
bio: Elena has been with Microsoft for over 15 years focusing on security and compliance for numerous software offerings as well as central organizational guidance.

title: Principal Product Manager Lead

As Head of Engineering, he leads the development of cutting-edge solutions that extend Power BI with advanced planning, budgeting, & forecasting. With a strong foundation in software architecture and a proven record of team leadership, Emil excels in bridging technical expertise with clear, strategic communication. His innovative approach ensures the delivery of robust, data-driven products that empower organizations to realize their full analytical potential.

Before this role, I was a Product Manager on the Azure SQL Database team, specializing in High Availability and Disaster Recovery scenarios. I am dedicated to building data-driven products and ensuring a seamless user experience. Outside of work, I am a volunteer diver at the Seattle Aquarium, where I feed the fish.

title: Product Manager

title: Chief Technology Officer
bio:
Eric has spent the entirety of his 10+ year career working in the enterprise information management space. As Chief Technology Officer, Eric is responsible for all aspects of product development for Profisee’s software portfolio, both inbound and outbound.
Eric manages Profisee’s product strategy and roadmap, taking inputs from market trends, competitive threats, and evolving prospect and customer needs, and collaborates with Profisee’s CTO and product steering committee to drive product delivery. Eric also assists in communicating Profisee’s vision and roadmap for Master Data Management in collaboration with the CMO and sales organization.
Eric brings a uniquely customer centric focus to product management, having initially joined Profisee as the Director of Professional Services, forming and growing Profisee’s consulting division in alignment with the growth of the company. Prior to Profisee, Eric was the Practice Director for Business Intelligence at Intellinet, an Atlanta based consulting firm.

Erin Stellato is a Principal Program Manager on the SQL Tools and Experiences team, helping advance tools that customers use daily with SQL databases. She is passionate about data and chocolate, not always in that order. She previously worked as a consultant and was a Data Platform MVP, and has been an active member of the SQL community as both a volunteer and speaker. Her areas of interest within the engine include Query Store, Extended Events, statistics, and performance tuning; and she also enjoys helping accidental/involuntary DBAs figure out how SQL Server works.
title: Principal Program Manager
Data & Analytics Consultant

Erlend Øien is a Data engineer and Scientist, working as a Consultant at Evidi with an MSc in Computer Science from NTNU, Norway. His academic background includes a focus on databases, search, and recommendation systems. Erlend's skill set is a recipe of 3 cups data engineer, 1 cup software developer, 4 tablespoons data scientist, 2 teaspoons recommendation systems enthusiast, and a sprinkle of UX appreciation .

Erlend has dabbled with ML technologies for recommendation systems, explainable AI, as well as scaling workloads for distributed data processing. He has recently dedicated his efforts to data platform projects on Microsoft Fabric, with PySpark as his go-to tool. Moreover he is certified as an Azure Data Engineer, Data Scientist, and Fabric Analytics Engineer.

When Erlend is not refreshing the Microsoft Fabric blog for new features, he is passionate for everything regarding fermentation (and is edible or drinkable), particularly within the realm of baking!

title: Data Platform MVP | Lead Data and AI, Public Speaker, Innovate to Accelerate

He currently serves as a Principal Consultant and Lead Data and AI at InSpark, winner of the Global Partner of the Year (POTY) Award for Identity and the Dutch Partner of the Year (POTY) Award for Data & AI.

Erwin is a frequent speaker at various national and international data community events and has been recognized as a Data Platform MVP.

With 16 years of experience in the world of data on the Microsoft Platform, Erwin has spent the last 8 years focusing on the Azure Platform. His day-to-day work involves addressing complex customer cases and technical issues. Additionally, he is a member of the Technology Board at InSpark, where he leads a team of highly experienced Data Experts specializing in the Microsoft Data Platform.

Erwin is dedicated to helping customers maximize the value of their complex analytics environments, with a strong emphasis on solutions in the Azure Cloud (Platform as a Service) and Microsoft Fabric. As a Technology Board member, he continuously explores the latest opportunities and shares his enthusiasm with colleagues, the community, and customers. He is also a key stakeholder for the InSpark Solution (Managed) Oxygen, a Modern Data Platform Estate as-a-service and the Nitrogen Control Center a native solution build on top of Microsoft Fabric for easy data integration and data Processing.

title: Azure Data MySQL, Software Engineer II
bio: I joined Microsoft through the Microsoft AI Development Acceleration Program (MAIDAP) where I had the opportunity to work on AI / ML projects in various teams in Azure and Office. Now I am applying those skills at MySQL in Azure Data, working closely with collaborators from Gray Systems Lab (GSL) to introduce ML-oriented features!

title: Data Training that Respects Your Time
bio: Eugene Meidinger works as a BI consultant and Pluralsight author, specializing in Power BI and Azure. He has been working with data for 10 years.

bio:
I am working as Product Manager at Microsoft and leading Microsoft Fabric automation for 2.5 years. During this period, we have created a robust, unified Microsoft Fabric public APIs surface that consist of CORE APIs as well as Workload specific data plane APIs.
The platform is extensive and new APIs onboarding to platform is consistently growing.
I am looking forward to enriching APIs surface and enable developers to automate e2e Fabric automation scenarios using Microsoft Public APIs.

title: VP, Data Integration
bio:
Faisal joined Microsoft in 2005 and currently leads the Data Integration product family under Azure Data, responsible for Data Factory in Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse Pipelines, and Power Query. Faisal got his start with Data Integration soon after he joined Microsoft, leading the product efforts to incubate and ship Power Query as the de facto data connectivity experience in Power BI, Excel, Power Platform and Dynamics 365.

Faisal has been in a variety of engineering and business roles at Microsoft – across Developer Division, SQL Server and Business Applications. Prior to his current role, Faisal spent 4 years leading Business Applications Customer & Partner Success – responsible for scaling Dynamics 365 and Power Platform FastTrack and partner success programs.

title: Principal Program Manager, Azure AI Search

He is dedicated to empowering individuals and organizations to create innovative tech experiences. Before Microsoft, Farzad held various engineering and product management roles at Chevron Corporation. He holds a B.S. in Petroleum Engineering from Louisiana State University, with minors in Computer Science and Technical Sales, and an M.Eng. in Engineering Management from Cornell University.

title: Product Designer, Data Integration in Fabric
bio: Product Designer at Microsoft Fabric, Fatima brings years of expertise to create seamless experiences for a leading SaaS platform in Azure Data, empowering users to thrive in the AI-driven data era.

title: MVP | Owner & CEO
bio:
Frank Geisler is the owner and CEO of GDS Business Intelligence GmbH, a leading Microsoft Solution Provider specializing in Data and AI. He holds numerous prestigious certifications, including Data Platform MVP, MCT, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, Azure Security Engineer Associate, Azure Data Engineer Associate, and DevOps Engineer Expert. In his role, Frank excels in building robust Business Intelligence systems leveraging Microsoft technologies such as SQL Server, Azure Data Platform, Microsoft Fabric, and Power BI. He is also proficient in constructing Azure infrastructures and architectures using PowerShell and Bicep.

Frank is a prolific author, having written several bestselling books including "Power BI für Dummies," "Azure für Dummies," "Docker für Dummies," and "Pro Serverless Data Handling with Microsoft Azure." As a frequent speaker, he has delivered insightful presentations at major national and international conferences like the PASS Community Summit, SQL BITS, and SQL Server Konferenz.

In addition to his professional achievements, Frank co-founded PASS Deutschland e.V. in 2004 and has served on its board of directors for many years. He also leads the Microsoft Data Community Regional Chapter Münsterland, contributing significantly to the community's growth and development.

title: Senior Program Manager, Microsoft Fabric CAT
bio:
With over 23 years of experience on IT and Data Platform, Freddie had the opportunity to work in different big IT players, supporting and implementing a wide range of Data products.

At Microsoft, Freddie worked on different segments and industries with products such as SQL Server, Azure SQL DB, Azure SQLDW, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure MySQL and Azure Postgres SQL.

With experience working with different stakeholders, Feddie helped to implement, support and optimization of customer workloads, along with architecture and system designs on Data Platform.

More recently, Freddie joined the Microsoft Fabric Product group as member of Fabric CAT Team.

title: Principal Program Manager

He has gained diversified expertise in pre-sale, business development, cloud enablement, software architecture, project management & operations. He is a key technical influencer with strategic customers in winning their mindshare in Azure and Microsoft Fabric. He has excellent knowledge in technologies like RDBMS, NoSQL, Big data ecosystem, MPP platforms, Data Security, Event-driven architecture and DevOps

After some short excursions into Web Application development and a long and inspiring time as a BI consultant / Data architect at oh22data AG (including experiencing being a Data Platform MVP), she joined Microsoft as a Senior Program Manager at the Fabric CAT team in March 2022.

Apart from BI topics she also supports Diversity topics.

bio:
Product Manager experienced in user research and data driven design, delivering services and driving adoption. Skilled collaborator and communicator, passionate customer advocate.
I believe that data can tell a fascinating story. I am here to help us listen.

title: MVP Data Platform | Director
bio:
- Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) in Data Platform.

- Member of the Global Microsoft Azure Data Communities Advisory Board

- Architected scalable analytics platforms using Snowflake, Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, SSAS, SSRS, Azure Data Factory, SSIS, Matilion to automate ETL workflow. Produced reports and dashboards using Power BI Desktop, Service and Power BI Report Services
- Defined governance layer at enterprise level covering Power BI version control, roles and activities, lifecycle management for reporting, RLS management, Azure DevOps integration for data & analytics solutions, and Power BI Premium implementations

- Designed and developed Power BI applications integrating other technologies including PowerApps, Flow, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Azure SQL Database and Smartsheet to deliver actionable solutions
- Facilitated requirement sessions with business users, provided analytics strategy, and created BI roadmaps

- Delivered end-to-end BI solutions to Enterprise companies in US and LATAM

Industry expertise – Retail, Financial, Minery, Forestal, Pharmaceutical, and Manufacturing
Thought leadership – Speaker at international conferences including MS Build, MS Ignite, MSFT Business Application Summit, SQL Saturdays, Power Platform World Tour, and .NET conference tour. Served as Managing Director for Spain Data Analytics Publication

Before joining Microsoft, Gauri worked as a Software Engineer with Oracle and Quantiphi focusing on designing and implementing scalable systems, optimizing performance, and ensuring robust architecture. In her spare time she likes to attend dance classes, cook and go trekking.

title: Cloud Solution Architect
bio: I'm a big fan of data. I've been working for years with Power BI and Azure Data Analytics services. I'm fascinated every time, what our customers can achieve with our technologies. It motivates me every day and I really like to support our customers

He supports Microsoft Fabric’s Real-Time Hub, focusing on integrating Azure and Fabric events to enable seamless data integration. George also led the design of the critical features that helped evolve Event Grid to support IoT scenarios through MQTT support. With a focus on IoT and event-driven scenarios, George is dedicated to driving impactful solutions that empower organizations to harness the full potential of real-time data.

title: Architect, Data & AI

George Hu, Ph. D, is a technical leader with more than 15 years of extensive experience in LLM, Data, AI and Machine learning. George is the Architect, Data & AI at Microsoft and a hands-on leader building and supporting data intelligence services on Azure such as Microsoft Fabric, HDInsight, Azure Machine Learning etc.
George received a doctorate degree of Geoinformatics from University of Chinese Academy of Sciences and owned Executive Education on Strategic Leadership of Technology and Innovation from Harvard Business School. As ex-Chief Architect at Palo Alto Networks, George was responsible for leading the Enterprise Architecture team with function design and mapping overall Business/IT strategy into technology roadmaps. He has been helping the team with technology innovation on transforming to AI driven cloud-native paradigm.
Dr. Hu is author of book “Modern Data Architect on Azure: Empower data intelligent service by Generative AI” [ISBN: 978-1-83620-719-1].

title: Principle Program Manager
bio:
Gerd is an accomplished technology executive with over 13 years of experience at Microsoft. Currently, he serves as Principal Program Manager for Microsoft Fabric, where he collaborates with partners to enhance their offerings and define product strategy. Previously, Gerd led Azure Global's Europe Retail division, addressing large-scale engineering challenges with cloud technology, AI, Big Data, and IoT.
Gerd is also dedicated to education, teaching at different Universities for more than five years. His blend of deep technical expertise and strategic leadership makes him a sought-after speaker in the tech industry, contributing significantly to advancements in cloud computing, AI, and IoT.

title: Principal and Founder
bio: Ginger Grant shines as a Data Platform MVP, offering top-notch consulting in the realms of advanced analytics, machine learning, data warehousing, and the intricacies of Microsoft Fabric. Not just a consultant, Ginger is a prolific writer, sharing her insights through articles as a regular columnist for Pure AI, books, and on her blog, DesertIsleSQL.com. Her mastery doesn’t stop there; as a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), she imparts wisdom in various data platform areas, including Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse Analytics, Python, and Azure Machine Learning. Ginger’s blend of expertise and educational contributions makes her a beacon in the data community.

title: Founder & CEO
bio: Gopal Krishnamurthy is the Founder and CEO of Lumel (formerly known as Visual BI). He is a visionary who saw the rise of cloud data platforms and adopted very early on (Snowflake, Databricks, DBT) with Visual BI and successfully divested and exited the consulting business with the sale to Atos in 2021. When he also saw the BI market consolidating with Power BI, he positioned Lumel to become the #1 Microsoft Power BI AppSource Partner. He also predicted the rise of native apps on top of data platforms as organizations look to eliminate data silos as a prerequisite to make their data AI-ready. So, he doubled down on his vision of building an integrated Lumel native app that consolidates planning, master data, reporting and analytics on top of semantic models and envisions Lumel as the new “Face of Data” for everyday application needs.

Grant Fritchey is a Data Platform MVP and AWS Community Builder with over 30 years’ experience in IT, including time spent in support and development. Grant works with multiple data platforms including SQL Server and PostgreSQL as well as multiple cloud platforms. He has also developed in VB, VB.NET, C#, and Java. Grant writes books for Apress and Simple-Talk. Grant presents at conferences and user groups, large and small, all over the world. He joined Redgate Software as a product advocate in January 2011.
title: Data Platform MVP | Product Advocate, AWS Community Builder
Group Program Manager, PostgreSQL on Azure
bio: Guy leads the Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server product team. Previously, he was a tech strategy lead for Azure App Innovation in Microsoft's Customer Success Unit (CSU), and various program manager roles including SQL Server cloud infrastructure, Azure Core Compute and the Azure Linux team. In his spare time, he likes to write code and explore the Pacific Northwest.

title: DevOps Alchemist
bio:

He has formed his own company – Morph iT – based in Christchurch, New Zealand and provides consultancy services for many clients in the US, Canada, UK, Australia and NZ
He has 20 years IT experience in managing and deploying large scale databases on SQL Server technologies. He has been managing SQL Server since SQL Server 2000 and pragmatic approaches to delivering business value to end users is his career passion.

Educating and helping others learn is a driver for Hamish and he is a User Group Leader, International speaker and a repeat guest lecturer at universities.

title: Data & AI, Digital Technical Specialist
bio:
Harry Arce is a seasoned Digital Technical Specialist at Microsoft, with a strong background in cloud data architecture, artificial intelligence and project management. With over 18 years of experience at Intel Corporation, Harry has led digital transformation initiatives, driving innovation and efficiency through advanced data architectures and AI/ML strategies. Currently, at Microsoft, Harry specializes in Data, AI & Apps Innovation, helping businesses harness the power of data to make informed decisions and achieve digital transformation. title: Data Platform MVP | Power BI Contributor, Developer pbi-tools
bio:
Some ten years ago, after having spent over a decade as a Software Developer and Architect with Microsoft technologies, Mathias Thierbach moved into the Microsoft BI space. He soon landed on Power BI, but also realized quickly that the development and engineering tools and practices were nothing like the ones well established in software development. This is how pbi-tools started as a project, the only complete source control solution for Power BI.

During many years of leading a data management team at YouGov, he experienced the benefits of those efforts every day. Having open sourced the project in fall of 2021, Mathias spent a lot of his free time bringing source control and DevOps practices to the wider Power BI community. Today, as the founder of navidata.io, he focuses on the need for robust DataOps workflows and tooling across the entire Microsoft Fabric ecosystem.

In addition to his open source engagements, Mathias cares deeply about his role as an enterprise technology leader. Like many, once having started as a single contributor technologist, he had to pivot significantly when he moved into a manager role, responsible for building, stabilizing and growing a team of data engineers, analysts and architects. Mathias is now passionately sharing the many experiences and learnings that came out of that journey with the community.

He has supported several critical systems utilizing SQL Server and managed dozens of 24/7/365 SQL Server implementations. As a consultant, he works with customers large, medium, and small to migrate to the cloud, make their data estate operate efficiently, and find the right tools and solutions within the Microsoft Data Platform.

Meagan spends a lot of time thinking about how to use data integration and data visualization techniques to make data useful for people. She enjoys sharing her knowledge and experiences at conferences and user group meetings as well as through her blog (DataSavvy.me).

title: Senior Project Manager
bio: Megha Desai leads the Microsoft Fabric and Data Analytics COE team to empower enterprise customers to transform their business through digital solutions.

title: AI Evangelist Director
bio:
Life has no remote, get up and change it yourself.

Melody Zacharias is an AI Evangelist Director at Pure Storage, where she supports and enables the delivery of compelling solution outcomes for customers and partners. With over 25 years of experience in the IT industry, Melody is a Microsoft MVP for the AI & data platform and a Microsoft Regional Director, recognized for her expertise and leadership in data and cloud technologies.

Melody is passionate about empowering and inspiring others to solve business problems with innovative and cutting-edge solutions. She has co-authored several books on data, including two SQL Server Administration books by Microsoft Press, and she frequently speaks at conferences on data, technology, women in tech, and professional development.

title: Senior Product Manager, Fabric Shell
bio: Focused on enhancing developer productivity and efficiency within the Fabric ecosystem. Key achievements include the delivery of features such as the Multitasking Framework, Home and Create Hub, Global Navigation, Information Architecture, and Switcher Refactor, among others.

title: Founder & CEO
bio:
U.S. Marine Purple Heart Veteran Michael W. Allison Is A Highly Sought-After Keynote Speaker, TEDx Speaker, Best-Selling Author, Expert Leadership Trainer, And Award-Winning INC 5000 Entrepreneur.

Michael Allison is a US Marine Corps veteran, Purple Heart recipient, leadership expert, and the visionary CEO of The Adversity Academy Leadership Development Company. With over 20+ years of experience in leadership, Michael has transformed lives and organizations by empowering individuals to embrace adversity, break through limitations, and lead with resilience around the globe.

Michael’s path to leadership was cemented during his devoted and faithful years of service in the United States Marine Corps, where he deployed to combat zones in the aftermath of 9/11 and the Iraq War where he led his unit on several mission critical assignments. His military service earned him the prestigious Purple Heart and shaped his deep understanding of leadership under extreme pressure. These high-risk combat experiences have all served as the launching point for his proprietary “The UN-Leadership and Break The Bottle – 3-D” methodology. His proven methodologies serve organizations and team members to foster a mutual trusted environment of Resilience, Accountability, and Leadership.

As a globally recognized keynote speaker in areas of Leadership, Corporate Culture, High-Performance Teams and Mental Wellness. Michael has delivered transformative presentations at high-level leading organizations and Fortune 500 companies such as Microsoft, TEDx, NBC, and the University of Columbia. His keynotes, The UN-Leadership and Break The Bottle, challenge conventional leadership paradigms, inspiring audiences to take control of their destinies, shatter their own limiting beliefs, and unlock their full leadership potential.

Michael’s entrepreneurial journey has seen him successfully launch multiple businesses, earning recognition from outlets like INC 5000, Franchise Consultant, USA Today, and ESPN. He holds a Bachelors of Science in Business Information Security Systems and MBA in Applied Management from Indiana Wesleyan University. He was honored with the 2022 Distinguished Alumni Award from Indiana Wesleyan University, reflecting his impact as a leader, mentor, and advocate. Additionally, his insights have been featured in publications like VFW Magazine, NBC, multiple podcasts and most recently About Face Military Mental Health Tribute.

Through The Adversity Academy, Michael delivers world-class leadership programs and personal coaching designed to help individuals and organizations build resilience, embrace change, and drive results. His mission is clear: to inspire others to become resilient leaders who thrive in the face of adversity.

While his impressive list of accolades and contributions continues to grow, Michael remains unwavering in his commitment to serve others. Drawing on his experiences alongside senior military leaders, congressional representatives, diplomats, and even the Secretary of State, Michael is driven by a clear mission: to dedicate himself to cultivating a culture of accountability, commitment, and authentic leadership. Whether on stage, coaching, or leading his programs, Michael’s focus is always on empowering others to overcome adversity and lead with integrity. Off stage, he is a devoted husband to Courtney and proud father to Omar and Corey, embodying the values of resilience, dedication, and family in all areas of his life.

For more information or to download this bio, visit Michael W. Allison website.

title: Principal Program Manager, Fabric CAT
bio: Michael Kovalsky is a Principal Program Manager on the Fabric CAT team at Microsoft where he advises enterprise customers with regard to semantic modeling, DAX and performance optimization, Dev Ops automation processes and Semantic Link. He is the primary author of the Semantic Link Labs library for Fabric notebooks and various other tools built for the Power BI and Fabric community including the Report Analyzer and the best practice rules for Tabular Editor's Best Practice Analyzer.

title: Senior Product Manager
bio:
Born and raised in Panama City, Panama. I’m currently a Senior Program Manager at Microsoft for the product that changed my life: Power Query.

Before this Program Manager role, I was the Principal Consultant and President of my own company based in Panama called Powered Solutions which was a Microsoft Gold Partner in Data Analytics for many years.

title: Microsoft MVP | Lead BI Architect, Data & AI Solutions, Power BI Enthusiast, Super User Power BI Community
bio:
Lead BI Architect, with a background as business analyst with a 20-year experience, data analysis is one of his daily tasks, with Power BI a world of possibilities opened. Super User in the Power BI community since the start of the program back in 2018 that allowed him to achieve a Microsoft MVP for the first time in 2019.

The engagement with the community, went further in 2020 with the first presentation on DAX and the blog https://pbiportugal.com/. In 2021 there was a shift in his career with full time job in data, currently he provides solutions in Power BI and the Microsoft environment for customers in different business areas.

Making his own tools in Excel and VBA since University to improve the analysis and ways to show data that allowed users to have quick insights.
With Power Query and Power BI, the insights are easier and faster, and takes BI to a different level since removes the dependency on specialized professionals to have data as we need and when we need it.

title: Group Product Manager, Citizen Data Integration
bio:
The Data Integration team at Microsoft builds the product capabilities that empower several millions of users to ingest & transform data of any shape and size within a wide range of Microsoft products: Fabric, Power BI, Power Apps, Excel, Dynamics 365 Insights Applications, Azure Data Factory and more.

Technologies built by our team include Power Query, the M language and runtime, Dataflows, Connectors and the Gateway/VNet capabilities that enable best-in-class hybrid connectivity from the Microsoft Cloud to any data source.

As a Group Product Manager, I lead a world-class team of Product Managers and Technical Program Managers that drive product vision and making it a product reality.

I'm very passionate about data and analytics. I've spent a massive amount of time learning Power BI. Through this learning process I felt that others may also be interested. Thus, I created a website, a knowledge repository for all things PowerBI, ( powerbi.tips ). This site is uniquely set up for people to read and learn about data modeling and visualizations within Power BI.

title: Director of Data Engineering and Business Intelligence
bio:
Mike Diehl is the Director of Data Engineering and Business Intelligence at Improving Winnipeg (formerly Imaginet), a Microsoft partner with offices in Winnipeg, Manitoba (Canada) and with Improving offices across Canada, United States, and South America. Mike has over 25 years of experience using Microsoft database technologies and is an expert in Agile Analytics and Microsoft Azure DevOps.

Mike has spoken many regional, national, and international SQL events over his long career, including the PASS Summit in Seattle Washington, SQLBITS in London UK, and at various SQL Saturday events across Canada and the USA, and other development conferences in Canada.

title: Spark and Lakehouse Evangelist, Principal Program Manager, Fabric CAT
bio:
I'm a Principal Program Manager at Microsoft, while a Spark specialist by role, I have deep knowledge and experience with everything lakehouse to data warehouse design, tuning, CI/CD automation, and API development.

I started off my career writing VB script to automate business processes and reporting then eventually Power BI was released and I quickly became shadow IT. After successfully implementing Power BI and starting a BI center of excellence, I was on-boarded into IT and given the opportunity of building my companies’ first cloud data warehouse. Now after dozens of implementations, I love to share what I’ve learned and talk modern data architectures.

Besides this, Nikita founded a program called CodeUCan in 2014 to teach coding skills to elementary and middle school children. title: CEO

His interests are on Azure, Data Governance and Integration, Machine Learning and Visualization Tools like SSRS, Power BI and Tableau. The unifying thread throughout his career has been a passion for making people's lives better by getting to know their needs and finding ways to simplify the complex.

title: Principal Group Product Manager
bio: Ope is a Principal Group Product Manager on the Microsoft Fabric team. Fabric is a comprehensive data analytics platform that provides a unified environment for businesses and data professionals to manage, process, and analyze data from various sources. Ope leads a team of PMs who help build Fabric Capacities which provide the computing power that drives all of these Fabric experiences, like a “CPU” in the cloud. Ope brings a combined ~15 years of experience in the Product Management and Consulting Industries. She is excited to share insights on new features in Fabric Capacities and tips to help customers plan​ and manage their capacities better.

title: Azure Data Analytics Architect
bio: Oskari has several years of experience in using Azure for data analytics at scale. He has been designing and implementing numerous projects for some of the largest companies in the Nordics. As a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), Oskari conducts classes for subject-matter experts and consultants and provides external customer training sessions. He is also an active speaker at community events. Oskari has been honored with the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) award in the Data Platform category five times (2019-2023). Additionally, he is certified as an Azure Solutions Architect, Fabric Analytics Engineer, and Azure Data Engineer.

title: GM of Security and Privacy
bio: Paddy has been working in security for over 20 years and has been on both sides of the fence, from white hat hacker discovering complex exploits in the largest software offerings, to guiding the secure design of Microsoft's cloud offerings.

title: Principal PM Manager, Microsoft Azure Data - SQL Server on Azure VM

She is passionate about SQL Server performance and has focused on performance tuning and optimization, particularly from the developer perspective, throughout her career. She is a SQL 2008 MCM with over 20 years of experience working with SQL Server and co-author of the book "Learn T-SQL Querying: A guide to developing efficient and elegant T-SQL code" (https://aka.ms/LearnTSQLQuerying).

He also has a blog and YouTube channel under the name of HoosierBI with content focused on Power Query, DAX/modeling, and custom visuals.

Prior to joining Microsoft he was awarded Microsoft MVP award for his contributions to the community. Patrick is a regular speaker at many SQL Server Conferences and Community events.

title: Sr. Cloud Advocate

His current technology interests focus on Internet of Things, Cloud Applications, and Cross-Platform mobile app development. He keeps a steady supply of video games, provided by sixteen retro game consoles connected via A/V switch to a 29’ Sony Trinitron CRT television and has been known to perform as lead vocalist in Houston's Tool Tribute Band - Spiral Out. During time off, he enjoys taking care of his thirteen trees, riding mountain bikes, and walking his Shi Tzu - Romeo.

Founder of the Polish SQL Server Users Group (PLSSUG), today known as Data Community Poland. Regular speaker at conferences, community events and user groups. Former Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP).

title: Principal Architect, Data & AI
bio:
Peer is a seasoned expert with over 15 years of experience in Data and Business Intelligence (BI).

As a key member of the twoday Fabric expert group, Peer plays a pivotal role in developing best practice frameworks for Microsoft Fabric. His expertise includes implementing ingestion and data transformation patterns, as well as defining CI/CD processes and establishing efficient ways of working within Fabric.

Peer's deep involvement with Microsoft Fabric dates back to 2022, when he was part of the early private preview of what was then known as Project Trident. His early engagement has given him unique insights into the platform's evolution, making him a go-to authority on leveraging Fabric for modern data solutions.

With a passion for innovation and a commitment to excellence, Peer continues to drive impactful data solutions that help organizations unlock the full potential of their data assets.

title: Senior Product Manager, Fabric Data Warehouse
bio:
Peri is a Product Manager with 27 years in analytics, and a diverse set of experiences in the software industry across product engineering, sales, business programs and marketing. He has lived and worked in three continents, which helped him build a diverse cultural background. He is the author of "Learn Azure Synapse Data Explorer", published by Packt Publishing.

On his personal interests, Peri is a recording artist with a deep passion for writing and performing music. He also enjoys studying and practicing karate, and is an avid reader.

title: Chief Architect
bio:

He is driving strategic product growth and transformation, leveraging his deep financial services and engineering background to deliver significant change programmes with innovative and pragmatic solutions.

Since 2021, Phil has been focused on LSEG's strategic partnership with Microsoft, and as Chief Architect for LSEG's next generation enterprise Data Platform, has been working in close collaboration with the Microsoft Fabric and Purview product and engineering teams to deliver a modern and transformational data experience for LSEG customers.

title: Microsoft Fabric CAT team
bio:
Phil Seamark works on the Microsoft Fabric CAT team and is an accomplished database and business intelligence (BI) professional. Phil has an in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft BI stack along with extensive knowledge of data warehouse (DW) methodologies and enterprise data modelling.

Phil has expert knowledge in all facets of BI/DW including planning architecture, project management, dimensional modelling, performance tuning, ETL design, development and optimisation, report and dashboard design as well as installation and administration. Phil has written several books DAX and Data modelling and has also blogged extensively at dax.tips

As Microsoft’s Strategic Advisor – Data & AI, Prashant focuses on driving customer transformation by leveraging cutting-edge technologies, including AI and data analytics, to help businesses modernize their enterprise systems. He has successfully led numerous cloud migration and transformation projects across multi-cloud environments, working with large global pharmaceutical clients in highly regulated settings.

His extensive experience spans various industries and global SI/ISV partners. Prashant has a strong passion for leading ideation initiatives, building innovative frameworks, and fostering community engagement through knowledge-sharing and impactful content.

A trusted advisor and visionary leader, Prashant consistently contributes to webinars and roundtable discussions, positioning him as a key voice in the tech community. His contributions ensure that enterprises can stay ahead by implementing scalable, modern, and future-proof data solutions.

As Hexaware's Vice President of Data & AI, Prashant Dahalkar spearheads the data delivery, consulting, presales, and solutions divisions. In his pivotal role, Prashant orchestrates the integration of advanced data delivery and consulting solutions, positioning Hexaware at the cutting edge of technological evolution. As a Client Success Strategist for delivery excellence and the distinguished spokesperson for Microsoft Fabric at Hexaware, he plays a crucial role in shaping the future of enterprise data platforms. His strategic insights empower organizations to harness the full potential of cutting-edge cloud solutions, ensuring data integrity and compliance.

Prashant's influence extends beyond Hexaware, as he is a trusted advisor to Chief Data Officers (CDOs) and data leaders worldwide, as he guides them in navigating the complexities of modern data landscapes. His commitment to fostering secure, compliant, and forward-thinking platforms underscores his dedication to making a meaningful impact on society through technology.

Outside the boardroom, Prashant's passion for badminton and yoga reflects his holistic approach to leadership and life, fostering balance and well-being.

She worked as a SQL Server DBA, manager & director for over 20 years in many industries including the non-profit sector, education, big pharma, and e-commerce. She was awarded the MVP in the Data Platform 3 times beginning in 2017 and gave that up to accept her role as a Senior Program Manager with Microsoft in 2019. From traditional data warehouses to modern lakehouses, I have built, migrated, and optimized enterprise-scale data platforms that enable organizations to unlock real-time insights and drive decision-making. I specialize in Microsoft Fabric, Azure, and cloud-native architectures, focusing on Medallion architectures, governance, and scalable pipelines that balance performance, cost, and security.

Beyond my technical expertise, I am a speaker and thought leader, presenting at industry forums such as Big Data London, sharing insights on data modernization, governance, and the evolving role of data in business strategy. I thrive on mentoring teams, embedding a data-driven culture, and transforming raw data into actionable intelligence that fuels innovation.

As a Data Leader, my mission is clear: empower organizations with robust, future-proof data platforms, bridge the gap between business and technology, and drive data excellence at scale.

She has over 25 years of software industry experience, with a focus on Big Data, Cloud, AI technologies and has also spent time in academics, working as a Computer Science Adjunct Faculty Member at Stevens Institute of Technology.

Dr Yoğurtçu is a dedicated advocate for diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) and STEM education for women and has received several notable accolades for her work. This includes CTO of the Year at the prestigious Women in IT Awards, recognition as an Outstanding Executive in Technology by Advancing Women in Technology (AWT), inclusion in the “Top 50 Women Leaders in Technology for 2024” by Women We Admire and being highlighted as one of the “60 Female CTOs to Watch”. She is also an active Advisory Council Member for Drexel LeBow Center for Applied AI and Business Analytics, member of the Forbes Technology Council, and serves as an advisory board member for multiple organizations.

Dr. Yoğurtçu received her Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stevens Institute of Technology, NJ, a Master of Science in Industrial Engineering, and a B.S. in Computer Engineering from Boğaziçi University in Istanbul.

bio:
Yitzhak Kesselman is Vice President for the Messaging & Real-Time Analytics suite of products at Microsoft. The team’s mission is to enable businesses to make their operations highly data-driven by getting insights and taking actions in real time over billions of observations from across the organization. The team delivers Event Streams, KQL Databases, and Data Activator in Microsoft Fabric, as well as Azure Data Explorer, Stream Analytics, Event Hub, Event Grid, and Service Bus in Azure.
Prior to that Yitzhak was leading Alphabet’s Monitoring products, critical for the reliability of Alphabet's production infrastructure and products. The products provide actionable insights into service health metrics consequently impacting the reliability of all products from Google search to autonomous vehicles that serve 4B+ users worldwide.
Prior to joining Google, Yitzhak was leading Power BI Platform team (now Fabric Platform team) that delivered the infrastructure, common functionality and operations to Power BI and other Azure Data cloud services. Yitzhak and his team scaled the service more than 12x getting it the best in class service by Gartner and Forster.

title: Product Manager
bio: I am a product manager for Power BI Analysis Services at Microsoft. I focus on unlocking big data scenarios but dedicated to helping all customers get the most out of their data!

Zoiner Tejada has more than 20 years of experience in the software industry as a software architect, CTO, and start-up CEO, with particular expertise in cloud computing, big data, analytics, and machine learning. Beyond managing Solliance, Zoiner spends much of his time leading an expert team of data scientists and data engineers building sophisticated data pipelines for advanced analytics, capturing the best practices and learnings which the team delivers in trainings and hackathons to all sizes of customers. He was among the first to receive a Microsoft Azure MVP (“Most Valuable Professional”) designation and has since been awarded the MVP for eight consecutive years, including a dual MVP award for Azure and Data Platform and most recently for Artificial Intelligence (AI). Additionally, he is recognized by Microsoft as a Microsoft Regional Director.

Zoiner is the author of a dozen books that range from business strategy to technical references on Azure. His most recent books include the Data Platform Practice Development Playbook and the Artificial Intelligence Practice Development Playbooks from Microsoft which inform Microsoft partners how to build their business and technical strategy to grow, nurture and optimize consulting practices in these areas. He also wrote Mastering Azure Analytics published by O'Reilly (which covers a broad range of analytics solutions from real-time processing with Storm, to Interactive/Batch processing with Spark, the application of Machine Learning and many other Data/Analytics related Azure services). He is also co-author of Exam Ref 70-532: Programming Microsoft’s Clouds (the official exam study guide for developers seeking Azure certification), co-author of Developing Microsoft Azure Solutions, and creator of the “Google Analytics Fundamentals” course on Pluralsight.com. He received his BS in computer science from Stanford University.
title: CEO and Architect
Data Platform MVP
bio:
Ásgeir is a Data Platform MVP and owner of North Insights ApS. He works on Business Intelligence solutions using the whole of the MS BI stack. Ásgeir has been working in BI since 2007 both as a consultant and internal employee. Before turning to BI Ásgeir worked as a technical trainer and currently teaches BI courses at the Continuing Education Department of the University of Iceland.

Ásgeir speaks regularly at events both domestic and internationally and is the group leader of the Icelandic PASS Group as well as the Icelandic Power BI user group.

Ásgeir is the co-author of Pro Power BI Administration from APRESS and the Power BI MVP book

Ásgeir is passionate about data and loves solving problem with BI.
